page.title: 14THE SAWMILL IN KILTARLITY
page.content: Balgate Sawmill is run by Ian Stewart who has recently modernised the old sawmill in the village.The wood for the mill is felled within a 30km radius of the village and is all soft wood - Scots Pine,Douglas Fir,Spruce and Larch.Nearly all the finished timber is sent to England and Wales as "carcassing"for the building industry. About 15 people are employed,between felling,transporting and in the mill itself. As well as finished timber the mill also produces pulp from "thinnings", saplings which are thinned from planted areas.Nothing is wasted.Bark is used for horticultural composts,and sawdust for chipboard. Most of the waste is exported to Sweden for making into paper.
